00116 
00117 PrimeSearch::PrimeSearch(int elements)
00118 {
00119         assert(elements>0 && "Can't do a PrimeSearch if you have 0 elements to search through, buddy-boy");
00120 
00121         maxElements = elements;
00122 
00123         int a = (rand()%13)+1;
00124         int b = (rand()%7)+1;
00125         int c = (rand()%5)+1;
00126 
00127         skip = (a * maxElements * maxElements) + (b * maxElements) + c;
00128         skip &= ~0xc0000000;            // this keeps skip from becoming too large....
00129 
00130         Restart();
00131 
00132         currentPrime = prime_array;
00133         int s = sizeof(prime_array)/sizeof(prime_array[0]);
00134 
00135         // if this assert gets hit you didn't have enough prime numbers to deal with this number of 
00136         // elements. Go back to the web site.
00137         assert(prime_array[s-1]>maxElements);
00138 
00139         while (*currentPrime < maxElements)
00140         {
00141                 currentPrime++;
00142         }
00143 
00144         int test = skip % *currentPrime;
00145         if (!test)
00146                 skip++;
00147 }
00148 
00149 int PrimeSearch::GetNext(bool restart)
00150 {
00151         if (restart)
00152                 Restart();
00153 
00154         if (Done())
00155                 return -1;
00156 
00157         bool done = false;
00158 
00159         int nextMember = currentPosition;
00160 
00161         while (!done)
00162         {
00163                 nextMember = nextMember + skip;
00164                 nextMember %= *currentPrime;
00165                 searches++;
00166 
00167                 if (nextMember < maxElements)
00168                 {
00169                         currentPosition = nextMember;
00170                         done = true;
00171                 }
00172         }
00173 
00174         return currentPosition;
00175 }
